text:
Just in: @CoryBooker announces support for NJ marijuana legalization effort: 

“New Jersey is the first state in the country to couple decriminalizing marijuana with strong criminal justice reform measures to redress the decades of immense harm  inflicted by an unfair system."
author: NYTnickc

text:
In a statement on New Zealand, @Malinowski also criticizes role of tech and social media in extremism: 

"It is intensified by social media platforms whose very design drives people to political extremes."
author: NYTnickc

text: His closing line: "it should have been taken down a lot more swiftly. The mechanisms should be in place to allow these companies to do that."
author: NYTnickc

text: In condemning New Zealand attacks, @CoryBooker also notes responsibilities of tech: "Tech companies have a responsibility to do the morally right thing. I don’t care about your profits. ... And this is a case where you’re giving a platform to hate. That’s unacceptable."
author: NYTnickc

text: Booker was pretty adamant in his response: "You can't campaign wrong and think you're going to govern right. I want to be a part of the solutions to the challenges of America. I don't want to contribute to that."
author: NYTnickc

text:
Asked @CoryBooker about this in SC last month and he also said he would not go negative: 

"I'm not going to run negative ads and I look forward to continuing to show people that I'm going to govern and call on people to end this politics of pitting each other against each other"
author: NYTnickc

text: Murphy, in promoting legalizing marijuana, says "I will only sign this if it expunges the records of those who have been put through our criminal justice system for prior marijuana offenses."
author: NYTnickc

text: As @GovMurphy says "Let’s work together to apply the millionaire’s tax to every millionaire" to applause in the chamber, both @SpeakerCoughlin and @NJSenatePres stood still and stared straight ahead.
author: NYTnickc

text: Murphy, out of context: "I know it sounds like I'm fishing for applause, but I'm not."
author: NYTnickc

text: Entering the national conversation on wage inequality, @GovMurphy is resurrecting his pursuit of a millionaire's tax as part of his budget proposal:
author: NYTnickc

text: Murphy: "If it kills me, we'll rebuild NJ Transit."
author: NYTnickc

text:
.@GovMurphy kicks off his budget address: "Our license plates say, “New Jersey, the Garden State.” But even more than that, New Jersey is the middle-class state."

Speech as prepared for delivery clocks in at 6048 words. settle in...
author: NYTnickc
